STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 20, 2025
Sylvia Blythe
Mission Ranch
9300 Lahring Road,
Gaines, MI, 48436
Re: License #: CI250410439
Dear Sylvia Blythe:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 05/14/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker,
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4156-2 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter
care institutions; updated treatment plan
• (2) The updated treatment plan developed by
the social worker shall document input from
the resident, the resident's parents, direct
care staff, and the referral source, unless
documented as inappropriate.
I reviewed three youth files. Two out of three files did not have input documented
from the youth.

CCI Rule 400.4156-3-c Institutions not detention institutions or shelter
care institutions; updated treatment plan
• (3) The updated treatment plan shall include
all of the following information:
• (c) Changes in the treatment plan,
including new problems and new
goals to remedy the problems.
Indicators of goal achievement and
time frames for achievement shall be
specified along with a specific
behavior management plan designed
to minimize seclusion and restraint
and that includes a continuum of
responses to problem behaviors.
I reviewed three youth files. Two out of the three files did not have indicators of
goal achievement and time frames for achievement.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• R.400.4156, specifically goals, action steps, and time frame. Documentation
was discussed concerning these items.
• R.400.4136, specifically writing a policy for the workout/weightroom and
sending the policy for approval.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Team meeting agendas: The agency does well reviewing each individual
child's needs. It was suggested to incorporate their goals and actions steps
directly from their treatment plans to ensure the treatment plan directed their
services.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted one CAP for 2024. The last CAP for the facility was written for
the 2024 Interim. Both rules, R.40.4113 and R.400.4155 were completed and are
now in compliance as evidence by no citations this year.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and financial audit dated 11/6/24.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator assessment completed on 3/17/25. Based on
the 2024 audit they had non-compliances in R.400.113 and R.400.4155. They
have completed training courses to update staff on these requirements. They have
had four unplanned releases and identified the trend as youth were outside their
programming modality. Youth had violent and aggressive behaviors and frequent
AWOLs. The agency continues to grow and learn, completing quarterly internal
reviews assessing finances, behaviors and youth files.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff did not note any concerns and were well-versed in their role.
Youth did not voice any concerns. Youth spoke well about program and staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained and decorated nicely. Second floor bedrooms have
balconies off the bedroom doors, but doors are locked, and alarms will sound if
opened. There is a fireplace in the large living room, but it is not used. A workout
room is being designed in one of the extra rooms in the house. The agency had
equipment set up and were finishing the final touches.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
___________________________________ 05/14/2025
Venus M. Decker Date
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 20, 2025
___________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
